text.quote: 34A*: Clause 3, leave out Clause 3 and insert—
(1) An incumbent may petition the Lord Chancellor in writing for a certificate establishing the succession for an eldest living son.

(2) Under subsection (1) an eldest living son, which, in Scotland, shall include any son born to the incumbent and legitimised by marriage, must have been an eldest living son prior to this Act coming into force.
(3) A petition must be made within five years of this Act coming into force.
(4) Succession to the hereditary peerage or baronetcy shall be traced in accordance with the destination, but through the eldest child, without reference to gender.”
